greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest squared prime factor of the odd Catalan number (A038003(n)) or 1, if it is squarefree.
comment: Odd Catalan number is A038003(n) = A000108(2^n-1) = binomial(2^(n+1)-2, 2^n-1)/(2^n).
example: There is no a(1) because A038003(1) = 1.
a(2) = 1 because A038003(2) = 5 which is squarefree.
a(3) = 1 because A038003(3) = 429 = 3*11*13 which is squarefree.
program: ........c2 = [p for p,e in c.items() if e >= 2]
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Aug 02 2006
